cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles ESE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north-northwest, expected to turn northwest then west-northwest across the central Gulf of Mexico toward the north-western Gulf coast (Louisiana/Texas).
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast near Morgan City–Port Fourchon area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Punta Herrero to Cancun, Mexico (Hurricane Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Punta Herrero to Dzilam, Mexico (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-western Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana westward to upper Texas expected to feel impacts early next week
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds of 40–50 mph possible Monday evening through Tuesday morning at the port reaches
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 2–4 ft surge along southeast Louisiana coast, which can propagate up the Mississippi River channel toward port facilities
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches with localized amounts up to 8 inches could cause flash-flooding and drainage issues
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rainbands, river rise on the Mississippi, and port/traffic restrictions likely during approach and passage
